text: damn, krib doesn't work on ubuntu either. Again, the exploded iso seems to be missing the files required to be a functioning package mirror :disappointed:
and setting local-repo=false in the global profile doesn't seem to have stopped the ubuntu install stage from configuring the OS to use DRP's repos
Would appreciate advice, when folks are awake again. I seem to be hitting an uncomfortable number of landmines so far :disappointed:

Okay, done a bunch of digging, recorded findings in <https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision/issues/871> . tl;dr: `package-repositories` being unset by default leads to generating a preseed file that can never produce a working debian-family OS, due to the assumptions made about package mirrors in that family. This is the root cause of both my debian installs crapping out mid-installation, and my ubuntu installs having broken package management.

Late on a Sunday to be asking questions, but... Is there a way to force a node to reboot back into the same BootEnv, other than creating a task that just runs `reboot`?

The background is I have a machine on sledgehammer, and I want to repeatedly try running a workflow that's failing. So, every time the workflow runs, I want the machine to reboot and get put back to a completely fresh OS, rather than have cruft from past runs.
At a glance, I don't see a way of triggering the bootenv-change reboot action by hand, which is what's leading me to writing a reboot task. Thoughts?
